title: Srimad Bhagavatam - Canto 1 Chapter 2 | Kids Quiz (15Q)

questions.prompt: 1. What is the real test of a bona fide spiritual master according to SB 1.2.2?
choices: He knows all the scriptures by heart
He can cure the disciple from material diseases like lust and anger
He is very famous with many followers
He belongs to an old, traditional family
questions.feedback: Right! A true guru is like a doctor who can actually cure you. Knowing medicine books isn't enough—the doctor must make you healthy! A real guru helps you become free from bad things like greed and anger.

questions.prompt: 2. What happens when we keep hearing about Krishna?
choices: Nothing changes in our hearts
Devotional service grows and material desires decrease
We get bored and tired
We become magical wizards
questions.feedback: Yes! It's like cleaning your room—the more you clean, the cleaner it gets! Hearing about Krishna makes our hearts cleaner and cleaner, and we want less material stuff and more Krishna!

questions.prompt: 3. According to SB 1.2.6, what is the highest dharma (duty) for everyone?
choices: Getting good grades in school
Following rules that lead to pure devotional service to Krishna
Making lots of money
Being popular with friends
questions.feedback: Perfect! The best dharma is that which helps us love and serve Krishna purely. Even if we do other good things, if they don't help us love Krishna more, they're not the highest goal!

questions.prompt: 4. What must someone who wants liberation do according to SB 1.2.7?
choices: Travel to many holy places
Inquire about the Absolute Truth from someone who knows it
Read books all by themselves
Give up talking to everyone
questions.feedback: Correct! We can't figure out spiritual truths just by ourselves. We need to learn from someone who really knows—like learning math from a teacher who understands it, not by guessing!

questions.prompt: 5. When we fully hear and chant about Krishna, what three things happen (SB 1.2.8)?
choices: We get rich, famous, and powerful
The knot of false ego is cut, doubts disappear, and karma ends
We become invisible and can fly
Nothing special happens
questions.feedback: Amazing! Three big things happen: (1) we stop thinking 'I am this body,' (2) our confusions go away, and (3) we stop having to come back to this material world. Hearing about Krishna is super powerful!

questions.prompt: 6. What does 'unmotivated' devotional service mean in SB 1.2.9?
choices: Being lazy and not trying hard
Serving Krishna without wanting anything back for ourselves
Not having any reasons for what we do
Serving only when we feel like it
questions.feedback: Exactly! It means loving Krishna just to make Him happy, not to get toys, money, or even to feel good ourselves. It's like loving your mom not for gifts, but just because you love her!

questions.prompt: 7. How do our desires become satisfied according to SB 1.2.10?
choices: By getting everything we want materially
By rendering loving service to Krishna
By stopping all desires completely
By sleeping all day
questions.feedback: Yes! It's like when you're really thirsty—drinking water satisfies you, but drinking sand doesn't! Our soul is thirsty for Krishna, so serving Him satisfies us, but material things leave us still wanting more.

questions.prompt: 8. What is the complete meaning of 'dharma' according to SB 1.2.11?
choices: Just following rules we're told
Our relationship with and service to the Lord
Being nice to people
Going to temple on Sundays
questions.feedback: Right! Dharma isn't just rules—it's about our eternal relationship with Krishna and how we serve Him. It's like the difference between doing chores because Mom said so versus helping because you love your family!

questions.prompt: 9. To understand the science of God, whom should we learn from (SB 1.2.12)?
choices: Anyone with a college degree
Someone who has seen the truth face to face (tattva-darsi)
Professional teachers who teach for money
Popular YouTube influencers
questions.feedback: Perfect! We need a teacher who has actually realized the truth, not just read about it in books. It's like learning to swim from someone who can swim, not someone who only read about swimming!

questions.prompt: 10. According to SB 1.2.13, the Absolute Truth has how many features?
choices: Only one: the impersonal light
Three: Brahman, Paramatma, and Bhagavan
Hundreds of different forms
No features at all
questions.feedback: Correct! It's like looking at the sun—you can see the sunshine (Brahman), the sun reflected in water (Paramatma), or the sun planet itself (Bhagavan/Krishna). They're all the same sun but seen differently. Krishna is the complete understanding!

questions.prompt: 11. What is the main qualification for hearing about Krishna according to SB 1.2.17?
choices: Being super smart and educated
Having a faithful heart (sraddha)
Being born in a special family
Giving up everything first
questions.feedback: Yes! Faith is like opening a door—you need to trust a little to let Krishna in. Smart people without faith can't understand, but faithful hearts can learn even if they're not super educated!

questions.prompt: 12. What does Krishna do when we faithfully hear about Him (SB 1.2.18)?
choices: Nothing special
He becomes seated in our heart and removes our material desires
He gets angry at us
He hides from us
questions.feedback: Wonderful! Krishna personally enters our heart and cleans out the bad stuff! We make a small effort to hear, and Krishna does the big work of purifying us. That's His amazing mercy!

questions.prompt: 13. What sequence does SB 1.2.24 teach about purification?
choices: Give up everything first, then approach Krishna
Hear faithfully, develop attachment to Krishna, then detachment from matter naturally follows
Study alone, then meditate, then maybe hear
Material happiness first, spiritual life later
questions.feedback: Exactly! It's like getting a new favorite toy—you naturally stop playing with the old broken one! When we hear about Krishna and start loving Him, we naturally lose interest in material stuff. We don't have to force it!

questions.prompt: 14. According to SB 1.2.26, what is the real purpose of maintaining our body?
choices: To enjoy as much as possible
To realize our relationship with Krishna
To become famous and important
To accumulate wealth
questions.feedback: Right! Our body is like a vehicle to take us to Krishna. Even animals eat, sleep, and defend—humans should use their body for the special purpose of understanding God! That's what makes human life valuable.

questions.prompt: 15. What is the biggest misconception that devotional service removes (SB 1.2.30)?
choices: The idea that Krishna has a form
The idea that 'I am this body' and 'this is mine'
The belief in good and evil
The idea that we should try hard
questions.feedback: Perfect! The root problem is thinking 'I AM this body' and 'this stuff is MINE.' When we serve Krishna, we realize 'I'm not this body; I'm Krishna's eternal servant' and 'everything belongs to Krishna.' This understanding fixes everything else! It's like fixing the root of a tree—all the branches get healthy!
